verses.verse: (For the choir director; for flute accompaniment. A Psalm of David.) <S%H238>Give<s%> <S%H238>ear<s%> to my <S%H561>words,<s%> O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> <S%H995>Consider<s%> my <S%H1901>groaning.<s%>
<S%H7181>Heed<s%> the <S%H6963>sound<s%> of my <S%H7768>cry<s%> for <S%H7773>help,<s%> my <S%H4428>King<s%> and my <S%H430>God,<s%> For to Thee do I <S%H6419>pray.<s%>

In the <S%H1242>morning,<s%> O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> Thou wilt <S%H8085>hear<s%> my <S%H6963>voice;<s%> In the <S%H1242>morning<s%> I will <S%H6186>order<s%> [my prayer] to Thee and [eagerly] <S%H6822>watch.<s%>
For Thou art not a <S%H410>God<s%> who <S%H2655>takes<s%> <S%H2655>pleasure<s%> in <S%H7562>wickedness;<s%> <S%H3808>No<s%> <S%H9563>evil<s%> <S%H1481>dwells<s%> with Thee.
The <S%H1984>boastful<s%> shall not <S%H3320>stand<s%> <S%H5048>before<s%> Thine <S%H5869>eyes;<s%> Thou dost <S%H8130>hate<s%> <S%H3605>all<s%> who <S%H6466>do<s%> <S%H205>iniquity.<s%>
Thou dost destroy those who <S%H6>speak<s%> <S%H1696>falsehood;<s%> The <S%H3577>Lord<s%> <S%H3068>abhors<s%> the <S%H8581>man<s%> of <S%H376>bloodshed<s%> and <S%H1818>deceit.<s%>

But as for me, by Thine <S%H7230>abundant<s%> <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%> I will <S%H935>enter<s%> Thy <S%H1004>house,<s%> At Thy <S%H6944>holy<s%> <S%H1964>temple<s%> I will <S%H7812>bow<s%> in <S%H3374>reverence<s%> for Thee.

O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> <S%H5148>lead<s%> me in Thy <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> <S%H4616>because<s%> of my <S%H9596>foes;<s%> <S%H3474>Make<s%> Thy <S%H1870>way<s%> <S%H3474>straight<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> me.

<S%H369>There<s%> is <S%H369>nothing<s%> <S%H3559>reliable<s%> in <S%H6310>what<s%> they <S%H6310>say;<s%> Their <S%H7130>inward<s%> <S%H7130>part<s%> is <S%H1942>destruction<s%> [itself]; Their <S%H1627>throat<s%> is an <S%H6605>open<s%> <S%H6913>grave;<s%> They <S%H9140>flatter<s%> with their <S%H3956>tongue.<s%>

<S%H816>Hold<s%> them <S%H816>guilty,<s%> O <S%H430>God;<s%> By their own <S%H4156>devices<s%> let them <S%H5307>fall!<s%> In the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of their <S%H6588>transgressions<s%> <S%H5080>thrust<s%> them out, For they are <S%H4784>rebellious<s%> against Thee.

But let <S%H3605>all<s%> who <S%H2620>take<s%> <S%H2620>refuge<s%> in Thee be <S%H8055>glad,<s%> Let them <S%H5769>ever<s%> <S%H7442>sing<s%> for <S%H7442>joy;<s%> And mayest Thou <S%H5526>shelter<s%> them, That those who <S%H157>love<s%> Thy <S%H8034>name<s%> may <S%H5970>exult<s%> in Thee.
For it is Thou who dost <S%H1288>bless<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> <S%H6662>man,<s%> O <S%H3068>Lord,<s%> Thou dost <S%H9401>surround<s%> him with <S%H7522>favor<s%> as with a <S%H6793>shield.<s%>
